settings.main_desktop_detail_text: Order a $2 sample block to try it out first.

settings.main_product_desc_text:
Kit includes everything you need to install in minutes:

  • 4 custom-cut frame legs with pre-installed, high-grade double-stick tape
  • Corner connectors + glue for easy corner assembly
  • Mounting instructions + frame placement guides

settings.main_information_text:
Buy 4 samples and get your
5th one FREE!

settings.title: Designed to fit
settings.main_information_text: MirrorMate frames are compatible with most plate glass mirrors, including those that rest on a backsplash or abut a wall. They attach directly to the glass without needing space around the mirror and are even designed to conceal any existing clips and channels.

settings.title: Install in under 30 minutes
settings.main_information_text: We've all struggled with products that promise easy assembly but don't deliver, that’s why our DIY frame kits include everything you need to build your frame—you just provide a small hammer.

settings.title: Non-warping material
settings.main_information_text: All frames are made of MDF: an environmentally-responsible, strong, non-warping wood-base. They are then finished with a moisture-impervious decorative wrap and seal. If for any reason your frame warps we’ll replace it! We also use an industrial grade adhesive so you can be sure your frame won’t fall off your mirror.

settings.title: Crafted in Charlotte, NC
settings.main_information_text: We take great pride in the craftsmanship of our custom frames, which is why each kit is made to order at our facility in Charlotte, North Carolina.

settings.title: Built to last
settings.main_information_text: All it takes to keep your frame looking good as new is simple dusting, or a light wiping with a cloth or paper towel that’s slightly dampened with water.  Easy as that!

settings.title: 1. Set it up
settings.main_information_text: Lay your frame pieces down flat on the floor, and line up the edges. We’ve marked each leg with a top and bottom label to make things easy for you. Slide something flat under each corner that you won’t mind getting glue on (ex. cardboard, drop cloth).

settings.title: 2. Assemble the corners
settings.main_information_text: One corner at a time, lightly apply a thin coat glue of glue, aligning the ends together to form your frame. Insert connectors into each glued corner starting with the short connector in the outer slot. Lightly hammer until flush then repeat with the interior, long connectors.

settings.title: 3. Prepare your mirror
settings.main_information_text: Within 10 minutes of application, wipe off any excess glue from the front of the frame with a damp rag before glue sets. Let glue dry for 20 minutes. Prepare your mirror by cleaning the edges where the frame will apply with the alcohol wipe provided. Allow to dry for 5 minutes so the mounting tape will adhere properly.

settings.title: 4. Align the frame
settings.main_information_text: Locate placement corner blocks and remove tape backing from the blocks. Lift frame into place so that it covers the mirror surface evenly on all sides. Once in place, press the placement corner blocks to both upper inside frame corners, as shown.

settings.title: 5. Press on to install
settings.main_information_text: Take the frame down and peel off the frame’s tape backing. Without touching the frame to the mirror, guide the frame into place using the placement corner blocks. Starting at the top edge, firmly press the frame to your mirror. Run your hand around all edges of the frame to secure it in place.

settings.title: 6. Enjoy!
settings.main_information_text: Remove placement corner blocks and clean any residue with rubbing alcohol if necessary. Stand back and look at your gorgeous, framed mirror.

settings.main_Answer_text: Check our frequently asked questions or email us at info@mirrormate.com.

settings.main_information_text: The perfect facelift for new construction, dated, or decaying bathroom mirrors.

settings.title: Will this work for mirrors that have clips or a metal channel?
settings.infos: Yes! Our frames are specially designed to cover and hide the clips and channels holding your existing mirror. The patented frames work seamlessly with almost all clips, with the exception of large plastic clips that are both 1” wide and 1” long. In this case, you can use the replacement clips included in with order. If your clips are plastic, but smaller than 1” you should not need replacement clips.

settings.title: What if I don’t have extra space around my mirror?
settings.infos: Don’t worry, this happens all the time! Since the frame attaches directly to the mirror, no space is needed around the mirror. In the order process, when asked about space around your mirror, you will just select 0”. Your frame will be cut to fit your space.

settings.title: Will the humidity from the shower affect the adhesive on the frame?
settings.infos: MirrorMate’s high quality frames are durability tested and made for the bath. They’ve been used for over a decade, even in such high traffic settings as hotels – and have stood the test of time. We’re so sure of it, we guaranteed the frames to last. For more info, see our guarantee.

settings.title: Are the frames easily removable?
settings.infos: Yes. If the frame must come off we recommend using dental floss or fishing line to separate the foam tape from the mirror. We suggest you use Goof-Off, or a citrus-based cleaner to remove the rest of the tape from the surface of the mirror. Please understand that we cannot guarantee that your frame would be usable should you choose to remove it. E-mail info@mirrormate.com for removal instructions. It will be necessary for us to send you replacement tape and placement corners.

settings.title: I have a unique shaped mirror, or measuring question, what do I do?
settings.infos: For more information on measurements, installation, or special cases, check out or FAQs. You can also chat with us, email us at info@mirrormate.com or give us a call at (866) 304-6283 from 9am-5pm M-F.
